history.content: Personally speaking it’s always a very bad idea to wait until the last semester to take any required class.  You don’t want to be that guy offering $100 to each student to drop the class so that you can get in.

I am a sophomore declared CS student wondering whether anyone is/has taken EE16B as a senior (otherwise anyone who may know) who could comment on how difficult it is to get into the class that late in their academic career? I am planning to do this for various reasons, chiefly because I am more interested in software classes and other applications like graphics, VR, etc., and I plan to take related classes as soon as I can. I heard that it might be difficult to get into the class as a senior given the reserved seating for freshman/sophomore students; and I wouldn't want to jeopardize my graduation by not getting into the class at the very end. I understand from many previous posts about this course the kinds of classes it prepares one for, and I don't really plan to take any of them (I also was in the class and dropped just before the drop deadline, so I that also informed my decision). Also, if anyone is doing this, how hard is it to get by after not having taken EE16A for so long (I took it my first semester here)? Any input on this is appreciated.
history.subject: Enrolling* in EE16B as last class before graduating?
